title: MLB Rumors: Ex-Mass. Governor Mitt Romney Bids For Yankees Ownership Stake | MLB | NESN.com
text:
by Marcus Kwesi O'Mard on Thu, Feb 23, 2017 at 2:55PM 6,320 Tweet 
Mitt Romney has exited the political spotlight but he could return to the sports world with a splash. 
The former Massachusetts governor and U.S. presidential candidate is in talks to buy a stake in the New York Yankees, FanRag Sports’ Jon Heyman reported Thursday. Romney and his son Tagg are expected to bid around $25-30 million for each percentage point of the teams’ shares. 
The Steinbrenner family owns the Yankees, which Forbes valued in 2016 at $3.4 billion — the highest of any Major League Baseball team. 
Heyman also reports the Romneys offer Florida Marlins owner Jeffrey Loria $1.4 billion for the club last year, but the sale never happened. 
Romney declared himself to be a Boston Red Sox fan during his time in Massachusetts. That didn’t stop him from investing in the Yankees in 2007 and pursuing a larger stake in the team 10 years later. 
Business trumps loyalty for some sports fans.
